frame.name: Discussion
frame.definition:
<def-root>Two (or more) people (the <fen>Interlocutors</fen>, also encodable as <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> and <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>) talk to one another. No person is construed as only a speaker or only an addressee. Rather, it is understood that both (or all) participants do some speaking and some listening--the process is understood to be symmetrical or reciprocal. This frame differs from the Chatting frame in that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> have a particular question that they are attempting to decide or understand.
<ex><fex name="Interlocutor_1">I</fex> would rather <t>discuss</t> <fex name="Topic">politics</fex> <fex name="Interlocutor_2">with anyone but him</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Interlocutors">World leaders</fex> met to <t>discuss</t> <fex name="Topic">global warming</fex> <fex name="Time">on the coldest day of the year.</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutor_1
FE.definition: <def-root>In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this FE identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>. Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole. <ex><fex name="Interlocutor_1">The President</fex> <t>conferred</t> with his top advisor.</ex> <ex><fex name="Interlocutor_1">I</fex> <t>discussed</t> evolution with Gould to prove he was wrong about it.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutor_2
FE.definition: <def-root>In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>). Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. <ex>The President <t>debated</t> <fex name="Interlocutor_2">with his top advisor</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutors
FE.definition:
<def-root>In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the FE role <fen>Interlocutors</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the FE <fen>Interlocutors</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Discussion frame, it is possible for the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.
<ex>(1) <fex name="Interlocutors">The President and his advisor</fex> <t>discussed</t> the Venezuelan situation briefly before the summit.</ex> <ex>(2)<fex name="Interlocutors"> The lawyers</fex> <t>conferred</t> before the trial.</ex> <ex>(3)<fex name="Interlocutors">The committee</fex> <t>debated</t> the bill for only a few minutes.</ex> <ex>(4) There was a brief <t>exchange</t> <fex name="Interlocutors">between the lawyers</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Topic</fen> expresses the subject that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> are trying to come to some agreement about. It may refer, for example, to an undesirable issue that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> want to have the proper response to, or it may refer more directly to an unresolved question.
<ex>The President and his top advisors <t>discussed</t> <fex name="Topic">the scandal</fex>.</ex> <ex>They had a <t>discussion</t> <fex name="Topic">about the scandal</fex>.</ex> <ex>The participants <t>debated</t> <fex name="Topic">whether the US should soften its response</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Language
FE.definition:
<def-root>The linguistic system(s) used by the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> to discuss something.
<ex>In our house everybody debated politics <fex name="Language">in three different languages at once</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Amount_of_discussion
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Amount_of_discussion</fen> applies to phrases expressing how thoroughly a <fen>Topic</fen> has been discussed.
<ex>This issue had been <fex name="Amount_of_discussion">exhaustively</fex> <t>discussed</t></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a depictive phrase describing <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> or the pair of <fen>Interlocutors</fen>.
<ex>Jack and Jill <t>discussed</t> the issue <fex name="Depictive">unaware of its full import</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element marks phrases that expresss the <fen>Manner</fen> in which one or both of the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> communicate.
<ex>They <t>debated</t> <fex name="Manner">amicably</fex> over who should pay the restaurant bill.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Elememt marks constituents expressing the means the parties to the conversation use to talk to each other.
<ex>Email allows people to <t>communicate</t> <fex name="Means">electronically</fex></ex> <ex>They briefly <t>conferred</t> with each other <fex name="Means">via a quick series of eyebrow twitches and a quirk of the mouth</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Duration</fen> of the conversation.
<ex>They had a <fex name="Duration">short</fex> <t>conference</t> off by the stable.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The goal that <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> or the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> jointly have, i.e. the state of affairs that they wish to bring about by the conversation.
<ex>You engage in such idle <t>debate</t> <fex name="Purpose">just to see how long I'll let it go</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the discussion takes place.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last year</fex> the participants <t>discussed</t> taking down the last trade barriers without consensus.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which a discussion takes place.
<ex>We just <t>conferred</t> for a couple of hours <fex name="Place">up in her room</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means_of_communication
FE.definition:
<def-root>The device or system that facilitates a discussion.
<ex>If we held a <t>debate</t> <fex name="Means_of_communication">on the radio</fex>, noone would be listening -- you could say whatever you wanted!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or a state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the discussion takes place and of which it is taken to be part.
<ex>Did you catch that <fex name="con_eve">"Your Local News Now"</fex> <t>discussion</t> about rising crime in suburban areas?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times the discussion happens in a given period of time.
<ex>I came to enjoy our <fex name="fre">frequent</fex> <t>discussions</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The general field or area in which the discussion takes place, or which shapes the discussion or its topic.
<ex>This prompted a rather <fex name="dom">philosophical</fex> <t>debate</t> about the importance of having a purpose in life.</ex></def-root>
